materials.name: Pt0_2-MOF

synthesis_steps.description: Preparation of a 3D MOF with a ligand derived from the amino acid l-methionine, formula {CaIICuII6[(S,S)-methox]3(OH)2(H2O)}·16 H2O (1), featuring pores decorated with thioalkyl chains.
Incorporation of Pt2+ cations by anchoring the metal salt K2-[PtCl4] to 1 through the S atoms of the coordination network, yielding {CaIICuII6[(S,S)-methox]3(OH)2(H2O)}·13 H2O (2).
Reduction of 2 with NaBH4 to obtain (Pt0_2)0.5-(PtIICl2)@{CaIICuII6[(S,S)-methox]3(OH)2(H2O)}·15 H2O (3).
synthesis_steps.yield: High loading of platinum atoms (ca. 17 wt % for both 2 and 3), 50 % of which are Pt0_2 units in 3.

materials.additional_information: The obtained Pt0_2-MOF material catalyzes reactions such as room-temperature NH4CN production, the methanation of CO2, and the hydrogenation of ethylene and C6 olefins at < 140 88C.
